TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 318

barker_notes.barker_summary: Order for shot, to be shipped to Louisville.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 318

div1.p: Order for shot, to be shipped to Louisville.

You will ship for my account and risque to the care of Messr Hall and Thomas Lewisville—Kentuckey on board of some safe boat bound to that place Two thousand Six Hundred and seventy-five pounds, of shott on an Order from C Wilt—-also Seven Hundred pounds of shott bought from M Austin Agreeably to my Order to you
